page.title: 10Devon Lanes
page.content:
Many of the roads in our area are single track lanes. They are quite narrow and quite twisty.
On either side of the lane there is usually a hedge. The bottom part of the hedge is made of stone and earth. There is no cement and mortar, so the wall is known as a{dry-stone}wall. This walling is built and kept up by the local farmers. Re-building fallen dry-stone walling is very skillful, and very hard work.
Lots of{wild plants}grow in the bank and this covers the whole wall with a blanket of pretty flowers. People on holiday sometimes find that the banks are much harder than they look when they bump into them in their cars!
